001package org.biopax.validator.web.service;
002
003import org.biopax.paxtools.normalizer.Normalizer;
004import org.biopax.validator.api.beans.Behavior;
005import org.biopax.validator.api.beans.Validation;
006import org.springframework.core.io.Resource;
007
008import java.io.IOException;
009
010public interface ValidatorAdapter {
011  /**
012   * Parses and checks BioPAX data from the given resource
013   * and returns the validation report.
014   *
015   * @param data input biopax model source
016   * @param maxErrors optional, if greater than 0, abort once the number of critical errors exceeds the threshold
017   * @param fixErrors optional, when true, some validator rules can auto-fix the model (issues still get reported)
018   * @param level optional, if 'ERROR' then warnings are ignored; 'WARNING' - both errors and warnings are reported.
019   * @param profile optional, validation rules' behavior settings profile, e.g., 'notstrict', 'default'
020   * @param normalizer optional, pre-configured biopax normalizer
021   * @return validation report
022   * @throws IOException when fails to read the data
023   */
024  Validation validate(Resource data, int maxErrors, boolean fixErrors,
025                      Behavior level, String profile,
026                      Normalizer normalizer) throws IOException;
027
028  /**
029   * @return Validator results XML schema.
030   */
031  String getSchema();
032}
